args: The Empire has seized our village!
The new lord levied heavy taxes on us and\ndrafted our men to fightâ€”and now he's\nsent soldiers to see his will done!
We'll starve to death before the winter\nis out if he sees this plan through!\nWe don't know what to do!
All right. I'll take care of it.
Pray allow me to accompany you.\nI cannot overlook citizens in trouble.
The lord said he wanted to teach a lesson,\nso he did. Said he'd use us as an example\nof what happens to those who defy him.
This is naught but base tyranny!
Please, sir! Please lessen our taxes\njust a little! We're but a poor village!
If you can't pay with coin, you'll pay with\nyour service. Take him to the militia!
I can't just stand here and watch this!
Wait. I understand well your rage,\nbut now is not the time to interfere.
You are an enemy of this Empire, yes?
If you were to interfere, it would go badly\nfor this village in the future no matter\nhow things end today.
It would be better for an outsider to take\non this task. Pray allow me to do so.
Patience wins wars, not anger.\nDo not let your feelings control you.
Wait and watch, then seize the\nopportunity to do as you must.
He's walking right toward those soldiers!\nThey'll kill him dead, so they will!
Let's trust he knows what he's doing.
Please, sir! If you take my son away,\nthere's no one left to work the fields!
Would you prefer we burn your pathetic\nhovel to the ground instead?
It ill befits a lord to threaten\nhis own people.
Ah ha ha! Who are you supposed to be,\nand what are you WEARING?!
My name is Ieyasu, and I am a traveling\nwarrior from the land of Hinomoto.
That dinky little island to the east?
Well, I don't care where you hail fromâ€”\noutsiders shouldn't meddle in affairs\nthat don't concern them.
You are a lord, yes? You rule over\nthese people and this land?
A lord should serve always the needs of\nthe people, and yet you bring naught\nbut pain and hardship.

I could remove your head from your
shoulders for such insolenceâ€”but as
you are clearly some foolish outsider,
let me enlighten you instead.
Those of low birth are duty-bound to\naid their social betters, much as a\nfarmer guides oxen with the yoke.

I come from a great line; these people
should be GRATEFUL to serve me.
That's something a wandering fool
like you could never understand!
You are correct. I do not understand...\nI do not understand how you can speak\nwords so lacking in honor!
What did you say to me?!
You lack all sense of honor and decency.\nYou life is devoid of meaning.
Those blessed to stand atop the world\nmust live a just lifeâ€”and that means\nthinking always of the less-fortunate.

You, however, think of naught but yourself.
That makes you no different from a wild
beast that exists moment to moment,
seeking only to satisfy its instinct.
You may be a stranger here,\nbut my mercy will only go so far!
Why do you point your weapons at us?!\nWe've done nothing!
What do you hope to achieve by\nthreatening your people so?
These people owe their fair share of tax.\n...Unless YOU mean to pay it for them?
They say a sword is a warrior's soul,\ndo they not? And the one you carry\nis fine indeed.
If you wish to save these people so badly,\ngive me your sword in their stead.
You would hostage your own people\nin order to gain my soul?
Why would you pay such a price for mere\nrabble that you don't even know?!
There is no price being paid here.
You seek to claim my soul, but you cannot\ntake from me what I have already given.
D-don't let this one scare you!\nAttaaaaack!
Huh. Point for courage, I suppose.\nGuess we'll do this the old-fashioned way!
You men! What's wrong with you?!\nWhy are you all falling over?!
Those lacking in skill can't even see\nmy sword in action. Pathetic.
I'm the dragon of battle!\nYour words are wind to me!
Now run, unless you wanna die here.\nRun and never look back.
Th-this village is madness itself!\nI'll never come back here again!
...He's a surprisingly fast runner\nfor a nobleman.
My apologies for frightening you.\nRest assured I am on your side.
But what will happen to our village now?\n
Worry not, good people. There is someone\nhere that will vouchsafe your safety.
From this moment forward, I will protect\nthis village in the name of the Alberian\nroyal family.
Mother of mercy! It's the prince himself!\nThe seventh scion of the Alberian throne!
I understand now what you meant when\nyou said I would do as I must.
Indeed, for you are the only one fit to\nwatch over this villa... Hmm?
Ah, yes. While I could have cut all of\nyou down, I chose instead to strike\nwith the blunt of my blade.
Marishiten is violent, but she has never\nslain a person against my express will.
Now that you have escaped death,\nthink carefully about how you will\nmake use of your lives from now on.
Well! I believe that is, as they say, that.
Why didn't you finish those men off?
The greatest victory is one gained without\nshedding a drop of blood.
It seems Marishiten understands\nthis as well.
And you only emerged victorious because\nyou understand each other so well...
Thank you for coming today, Ieyasu.\nThis story would have ended very\ndifferently if not for you.
You are an ideal leader; I hope to learn\nmuch more from you in the future.
However, I would be glad to impart\nwhat wisdom I may to you.
And I would be glad to listen.
